description.lang: WiDom Universal Roller Shutter is a blind control designed for being installed behind a standard switch. WiDOM Universal Roller Shutter is an Motor Control with auto calibration and self recovering position capabilities.

inclusionNote.lang: Start normal Inclusion by pressing the (B) button once or three times or alternatively by pressing the external switch once.

description.lang: Group 5: devices that will be controlled by hold on the external switch
Group 4: devices that will be controlled by a triple click on the external switch
Group 3: devices that will be controlled by a double click on the external switch
Group 2: devices that will be controlled by a single click on the external switch
Group 1: devices that will be notified of changes in its status

name.lang: Shutter control

description.lang: Enables\Disables the shutter's control trough the external Switch
Switch is disabled.
Switch is enabled.

name.lang: Favourite level for position ON

description.lang: Define level. 100% = FULL ON
From: 50 (50%) to 100 (100% - FULL ON)

name.lang: Favourite level for position OFF

description.lang: Define level. 0% = OFF
From: 0 (OFF) to 49 (49%)

name.lang: Action on the associated devices when the external switch receives 1 click

description.lang: Defines the actions to be carried out on the associated devices in terms of Basic Set. 1 – LIKE THE STATUS 2 – IGNORE IF ON 3 – IGNORE IF OFF 4 – IGNORE
Actions on the button ON = Basic Set ON_LEVEL Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON, Actions on the button OFF = No action

name.lang: Action on the associated devices when the external switch receives 2 clicks

description.lang: Defines the actions to be carried out on the associated devices in terms of Basic Set. 1 – LIKE THE STATUS 2 – IGNORE IF ON 3 – IGNORE IF OFF 4 – IGNORE
Actions on the button ON = Basic Set ON_LEVEL Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON, Actions on the button OFF = No action

name.lang: Action on the associated devices when the external switch receives 3 clicks

description.lang: Defines the actions to be carried out on the associated devices in terms of Basic Set. 1 – LIKE THE STATUS 2 – IGNORE IF ON 3 – IGNORE IF OFF 4 – IGNORE
Actions on the button ON = Basic Set ON_LEVEL Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON, Actions on the button OFF = No action

name.lang: Action on the associated devices when the external switch is hold

description.lang: Defines the actions to be carried out on the associated devices in terms of Basic Set. 1 – LIKE THE STATUS 2 – IGNORE IF ON 3 – IGNORE IF OFF 4 – IGNORE
Actions on the button ON = Basic Set ON_LEVEL Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON = No action Actions on the button OFF = Basic Set OFF_LEVEL
Actions on the button ON, Actions on the button OFF = No action

name.lang: Device status upon receipt of a Basic Set

description.lang: The device final status reached by the device when it receives a Basic Set command from the Z-Wave network. 1 – AS RECEIVED 2 – IGNORE IF ON 3 – IGNORE IF OFF 4 – IGNORE
IF Command received = ON, THEN Final Status = ON. IF Command received = OFF, THEN Final Status = OFF.
IF Command received = ON, THEN initial status is maintained. IF Command received = OFF, THEN Final Status = OFF.
IF Command received = ON, THEN Final Status = ON. IF Command received = OFF, THEN initial status is maintained.
IF Command received = ON or OFF, THEN initial status is maintained, or if the programmed switch-off timer is active, it is restarted.

name.lang: ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 2

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to 1-click association group.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 2

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to 1-click association group.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 3

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to 2-click association group.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 3

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to 2-click association group.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 4

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to 3-click association group.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 4

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to 2-click association group.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
OFF_Level parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: ON_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 5

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to Hold association group.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
ON_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.
Define value for dimming purpose.

name.lang: OFF_LEVEL value used for devices belonging to Group 5

description.lang: Defines the values associated to the ON_LEVEL and OFF_LEVEL parameters used in the Basic Set. commands. Values apply to Hold association group.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched OFF.
OFF_LEVEL parameter is switched ON.

name.lang: Smoke Alarm, CO, CO2 Action

description.lang: Defines how the device reacts when it receives one of the following types of alarms: smoke, CO and CO2.
The device status switches to ON.
The device status switches to OFF.
The alarm will be ignored.

name.lang: Heat Alarm

description.lang: Defines how the device reacts when it receives a Heat Alarm.
The device status switches to ON.
The device status switches to OFF.
The alarm will be ignored.

name.lang: Water Alarm

description.lang: Defines how the device reacts when it receives a Water Alarm.
The device status switches to ON.
The device status switches to OFF.
The alarm will be ignored.

name.lang: Home Security

description.lang: Defines how the device reacts when it receives a Home Security Alarm.
The device status switches to ON.
The device status switches to OFF.
The alarm will be ignored.

name.lang: Calibration

description.lang: Starts the system's calibration by setting the parameter's value as final level. During the calibration phase the parameter’s value is set to 1 and it is restored to the default value at the end of the procedure.
Set parameter value.

name.lang: Configuration Reset

description.lang: Defines what are the parameters to be restored to default values.
FACTORY RESET: the original manufacturer configuration is restored within the device.
ASSOCIATIONS RESET. all and only the associations are reset
CONFIGURATIONS RESET: the associations are maintained while all other configuration parameters are reset to the manufacturer's original settings, except for this specific configuration.
IGNORE: no action is carried out.

name.lang: Protection time

description.lang: Represents to maximum time allowed to complete a run (from completely open to completely closed). After that time the relay contacts are opened.
Define time value.

name.lang: Inversion of commands UP\DOWN

description.lang: Inverts the outputs controlling the motor. Once the inversion is enabled, the receipt of an opening/closure command will make the motor move in the opposite direction compared to what happens when the parameter is set on 0. WARNING: The inversion of commands starts the calibration procedure requiring the system to completely run twice, from being completely open to completely closed.
Inversion disabled.
Inversion enabled.

name.lang: Learn Mode

description.lang: efines the sequence of clicks on the external switch to be associated with the Learning Mode status. INFO: When Learning mode is associated to a click event any configuration related to the associated devices is ignored. The configuration is valid for a single event. After which the default value will be restored (0 – DISABLED).
Action of the Learning mode cannot be enabled through the external switch.
Learning mode activated by 1 click on the external switch.
Learning mode activated by 2 clicks on the external switch.
Learning mode activated by 3 clicks on the external switch.
